name: Family Favorite Casserole
ingredients: 1 lb ground beef, browned and drained
1 1/2 cups baby carrots, cut in thirds
directions: Combine all ingredients except milk, macaroni and cheese in crockpot.  Stir to combine.  Cover and cook on low heat 6 to 8 hours or high 3 to 4 hours.  Stir in milk and cooked macaroni during the last 30 (if on low) or 15 (if on high) minutes.  Sprinkle grated cheese over top.  Makes 6 to 8 servings.

name: Lemon Cream Cheese Cupcakes
ingredients: 1 pkg (small box) Jell-O Lemon Flavor Instant Pudding
directions: Preheat oven to 350'. Beat cake mix, dry pudding mix, water, egg whites and oil in large bowl with electric mixer on low speed until moistened. Beat on medium speed 2 min. Spoon batter into muffin cups.
Bake 13 min. Cool completely.
Make frosting:
Beat sugar, cream cheese, butter and juice with electric mixer on low speed until well blended.  I make 1/2 batch of frosting.

name: Chicken Broccoli Casserole
directions: Cook chopped chicken in olive oil and spices.  Boil broccoli until fork tender.  Cook rice.  Mix all remaining ingredients in a bowl.  In a casserole dish layer rice, broccoli, chicken and sauce.  Grate more of the cheeses on top.  Bake 375 degrees for 25 minutes until bubbly.

name: Eldorado Casserole
directions: Brown ground beef with onion and garlic, drain.  Add tomato sauce and bring to a boil.  In a bowl mix olives, sour cream, cottage cheese, and monterey jack cheese.  In a casserole dish layer chips (crushed into smaller pieces), meat mixture, and then cottage cheese mixture and repeat.  Add more chips and grated cheese on top.  Bake 350 degree oven 30-35 minutes until cheese is golden and  bubbly.  Can be frozen.  Cook for 1 hour if frozen.

name: Sweet and creamy Chex mix
directions: Bring corn syrup, butter and sugar to a boil and add whipping cream.  Cook until 232 degrees (soft ball stage).  Pour over cereal and stir to coat.  Spread on wax paper to cool.  *Optional add slivered almonds, coconut, etc.

name: Yummy Pizza Crust
directions: Dough can be frozen.  Defrost dough in fridge for 24 hours.

Mix warm water, yeast and sugar in a bowl.  Let it sit until it grows about 5 minutes.  In a larger mixing bowl combine flour and salt, mix in oil and yeast mixture.  Mix with dough hooks until combined.  Let rise for 20 minutes.  Roll out crust and prebake at 425 degrees for 5 minutes.  Top with favorite pizza toppings.

name: Queso Dip
directions: Brown and drain sausage.  Combine all ingredients in a pot and heat to melt cheeses.  Enjoy with tortilla chips or on potatoes.

name: Porcupine Meatballs
directions: Combine beef, rice, salt, pepper and onion.  Roll into 1\" balls.  Place in a large sauce pan.  Cover with tomato soups and enough water just to cover.  Boil/simmer uncovered for about 1.5 hours.

name: Rice pudding
directions: In a small saucepan, scald the milks together.  Measure the raisins into a strainer and set over boiling water just long enough to plump them.  In a heavy 2- or 3-quart saucepan combine cornstarch, salt and sugar (1/2 cup and 2 Tablespoons), and blend well.  Stir in hot milk mixture, stirring constantly over medium heat until thick and smooth.  Add rice; reheat to a full boil.  Remove from heat.  Pour a little of the hot mixture into beaten eggs while stirring rapidly.  Return egg mixture to hot milk and rice and stir until thickened (only a minute or two).  Remove from heat.  Stir raisins, spices, and vanilla.  Chill.

name: Easy Enchiladas
directions: Cut chicken into bite size pieces and broil until cooked, about 8 minutes per side.  Mix shredded cheddar, green chilies, sliced olives, cream of chicken soup and cooked chicken.  in a medium baking dish pour a little enchilada sauce in bottom of pan.  Cover with tortillas, some may have to be torn apart to cover all corners.  Add half of chicken mixture, then layer tortillas and more sauce.  Add rest of chicken mixture, then one more layer of tortillas and sauce.  Then grate more cheese on top.  Bake in 350 degree oven until cheese is melted and sauce is bubbly, about 30 minutes.

name: Coconut Curry Chicken
ingredients: 1 cups sweetened or unsweetened shredded dried coconut
directions: Bake chicken in a 350 degree oven until no longer pink in center of thickest part (cut to test), 20 to 25 minutes.

Rinse chicken and pat dry.  Pour butter into a 9- by 13-inch backing dish.  In a wide, shallow bowl, combine coconut and curry powder.  Dip chicken in butter to coat, then roll in coconut.  Place chicken pieces slightly apart in the baking dish.  Put any remaining coconut mixture on top.  Sprinkle with salt.

name: Sopapillas
directions: Sift the dry ingredients together.  Cut in the shortening until the mixture is the texture of coarse cornmeal.  Add the water gradually to form a dough.  Knead on a lightly floured surface until smooth.  Roll dough thinly and cut it into small squares, about 3 inches.  Heat oil until hot (375 degrees).  Fry bread until puffed and golden brown on both sides.  Drain on paper towels and dust with powdered sugar and cinnamon.  Serve with honey or honey butter.

name: Chicken and Rice Soft Tacos
source: Kraft Foods and our own improvisation
ingredients: 1 lb boneless skinless chicken cut into strips
directions: Heat oil in large nonstick skillet on medium high heat.  Add chicken; cook and stir 6 minutes or until cooked through.  Add water, salsa and seasoning mix; stir.  Bring to a boil.  Stir in rice; cover.  Cook on low heat for 4 minutes.  Add in corn and beans.  Cook for 2 more minutes.  Spoon chicken mixture onto tortillas; sprinkle with cheese, lettuce and sour cream.  Fold up sides to enclose filling.  Enjoy!!

name: Blue Bird Chicken Cordon Blue
directions: Preheat Oven to 350 degrees.
Mix together seasoning (salt, paprika, pepper, garlic).

Pound chicken breasts to tenderize, rub with seasoning.  Place ham and cheese on top and fold, secure with a tooth pick.  Place in well buttered pan with 7-Up, grape juice and stock.  Cover and bake 30-35 minutes.
Gravy:  Mix broth from cooking with cream, bouillon and cornstarch.  Cook until thick or boiling 1 minute.
Serve each chicken with a generous portion of gravy on top.

name: Baked Beans
ingredients: 2 16 - 18 oz cans of pork and beans
directions: Preheat oven to 280 degrees.
Cook bacon until it is about 3/4 done.  Put pork and beans in a large cooking dish and add bacon with grease.  Add remaining ingredients.
Bake uncovered 2-4 hours or until hungry.  Oven temperature should be adjusted for time of cooking.

name: Squash
directions: Preheat oven to 250+ degrees.
Peel and cut squash to about 3/4 inch cubes.  Place squash in baking dish.  Cook bacon till about 3/4 done and add bacon and grease to squash.  Pour sugar on top and salt and pepper as desired.
Cook for about 3 hours or until squash is soft.

name: Soft Italian Bread Sticks
directions: In bread machine pan, place the first eight ingredients in order suggested by manufacturer.  Select dough setting (check dough after 5 minutes of mixing; add 1 to 2 tablespoons of water or flour if needed.)  When cycle is completed, turn dough onto a lightly floured surface; divide in half.  Cut each portion into 12 pieces;  roll each into a 4-in to 6-in rope.  Place 2 in. apart on a greased baking sheet.  Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 20 minutes.  Bake at 350 degrees for 15-18 minutes or until golden brown.  Immediately brush with butter; sprinkle with parmesan cheese.  Serve warm.

name: Peppy Parmesan Pasta
ingredients: 8 oz angel-hair pasta, broken into 3 inch pieces
directions: Cook pasta.  Meanwhile, in a serving bowl, combine the tomato, pepperoni, olives, parmesan cheese, oil, salt if desired and garlic powder.  Drain pasta;  add tomato mixture and toss to coat.

name: Sweet and Sour Chicken
ingredients: 6 chicken breasts cut into bite size pieces
1 large can pineapple chunks in juice
directions: Place vegetables in bottom of slow cooker.  Sprinkle with tapioca.  Add chicken.  In separate bowl, combine pineapple, brown sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, bouillon, garlic powder, ginger, and salt.  Pour over chicken.  Cover.  Cook on low 8-10 hours or on high 5 hours.  If cooking on high, watch fluid level, may need to add 1/2 cup of extra water.  Serve hot over steamed rice.

name: Taco Casserole
directions: Brown hamburger and onion.  Mix with chili, tomato sauce and soup.  Put a layer of chips on the bottom of the crock pot, followed by a layer of grated cheese and a layer of hamburger mixture.  Repeat this for several layers and top with tortilla chips and cheese.  Cook in crock-pot for one hour or until heated through.  This recipe may also be made in a casserole dish and baked at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

name: Lemonade Chicken
directions: Arrange chicken pieces in crock pot.  Combine lemonade, brown sugar and ketchup and mix well. Pour over chicken.  Cover.  Cook on high 3-4 hours or low 6-8 hours.  Remove chicken from pot, cover to keep hot.  Transfer liquid to saucepan.  Skim fat; combine cornstarch and cold water and add slowly to liquid, while stirring over low heat.  When thickened, serve with chicken over hot rice.

name: Mexican Rice
directions: Measure Rice and pour in medium microwave safe bowl.
Open chicken broth and pour in a 2 cup measuring cup.  Add water to the 2 cup line (about 1/2 cup?).
Add cumin and chili powder and cook for about 5 minutes at 60% power in the microwave

name: Cucumber Salad
directions: Combine peeled and thinly sliced cucumber with red onion and rinsed, stemmed, seeded and thinly sliced jalapeno chili.  Add plain yogurt and lime juice and mix well.  Salt to taste.

name: Tamil Chicken
ingredients: 3 strips lemon peel, 1/2 in by 3 inches
directions: Cut lemon peel into small pieces; put in a food processor with cilantro, garlic, salt, turmeric, and pepper.  Whirl until finely minced.  Pat mixture over chicken.  Cover and chill at least 1 hour or up to 1 day.  Lay chicken on lightly oiled barbecue grill over a solid bed of medium coals or medium heat on a gas grill (you can hold your hand at grill level only 4 to 5 seconds); close lid on gas grill.  Cook chicken, turning occasionally, until no longer pink at the bone or center (cut to test), about 15 minutes total.  Transfer to a platter.  Serve with cucumber salad.  (also works well broiled)

name: Chili's Fajitas for Two
ingredients: 2 boneless , skinless chicken breast halves or 1 pound top sirloin or a combination of 1 chicken breast
directions: 1. Combine all of the ingredients for the marinade (fresh lime juice to onion powder) in a small bowl.  Soak you choice of meat in the marinade for at least 2 hours.  If you are just using sirloin, let it marinade overnight, if possible.
2. When the meat has marinated, preheat your barbecue or stove-top grill to high.

3. Preheat a skillet over medium/high heat.  Saute the onion and pepper slices in the oil for 5 minutes.  Combine the soy sauce, water, and lime juice in a small bowl and pour it over the onions and peppers.  Add the black pepper and continue to saute until the onions are translucent and dark on the edges (4 to 5 more minutes).  Salt to taste.
4. While the onions are sauteing, grill the meat for 4 to 5 minutes per side or until done.
5. While the meat and onions are cooking, heat up another skillet (cast iron if you have one) over high heat.  This will be your sizzling serving pan.
6.  When the meat is done remove it from the grill and slice it into thin strips.  Combine the peppers, onions and meat on the sizzling skillet.  Enjoy with the remaining toppings and tortillas.

name: Dollar Mints
ingredients: 1 cups Milk Chocolate pieces or dipping chocolate
directions: Melt chocolate, add mint oil 6 or 7 drops per cup. With fork or candy tool dip "Ritz" crackers into chocolate, tapping off excess. Slide coated cracker onto wax paper. After set, store in a container with a layer of wax paper between each layer. Can be made days before needed.

name: Good Stuff
ingredients: 1 cups Mixed nuts or nuts of your choice
directions: Mix cereal and nuts.

Bring to boil and boil for 2 minutes sugar, syrup and butter. Pour mixture over cereal mixture and stir until mixed together. Let slightly dry by stirring a couple of times before storing. For yummy variation use the above mixture and pour over Bugles, plain Puffs and cashews

name: Fudge
directions: Use a heavy pot
Stir together sugar and cream
Cook between med and high heat
When boiling put lid on 1 min
Do not stir again
Slice up butter 2 cubes, 3 large chocolate bars.  Break pieces chocolate into large bowl. I put both in bowl.
Cook sugar and cream to Soft ball.
Pour over chocolate and butter.
Using mixer, beat until looses gloss.
Pour in 9x13 pan
Let cool some
Freeze 20 min

name: Bisquick Quiche
directions: Grease pie plate
Heat oven 400
Sprinkle meat, cheese & onion in plate
Beat eggs in blender till mixed
Add milk, bisquick, salt & pepper in to blender.
Blend 15 seconds.
Pour over meat & cheese,
Bake until golden brown and knife inserted in center comes out clean.
Bake 35 - 40 minutes

name: Filled Cookies dough
directions: Combine all dry ingredients.
Cut in shorting as for pastry
beat egg and combine all wet ingredients
Add to dry ingredients and mix well
roll thin and cut into 2 inch circles
place 1 Tablespoon filling between two dough circles
pinch edges closed.

name: Filled Cookies Filling
directions: Place raisins to boiling water to soften
Drain save water
Chop raisins
Chop nuts
Add flour to sugar, Slowly stir into saved hot water
Bring to boil and add raisins, cook for 3 min.
let cool and add nuts.
Place 1 tablespoon filling per cookie.
Bake 450 degrees 8 to 10 min.
Bottom of cookie should be light brown.

name: Poppy Seed Chicken Casserole
directions: Boil chicken breasts in salt water and cut into pieces. Mix sour cream and soup together and pour over chicken.  Melt margarine, add cracker crumbs and poppy seeds.  Sprinkle on top of chicken and bake at 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes.

name: Poppy Seed Cake
directions: Mix all above until smooth.  Pour into a greased bread pans (2 large bread pans or 1 bundt cake pan).  Bake 45-50 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.  Turn cake onto a tray.  While cake is still hot, poke holes in the top and spoon on the glaze.Glaze: Mix vanilla, almond extract, butter extract, powdered sugar and enough orange juice to make a smooth thin glaze.This recipe is also good if you substitute lemon extract for all the almond extract.

name: Roasted Vegetable Salad
ingredients: 4 cups peeled, diagonally sliced carrots 1/4 inch thick
3 cups cauliflower florets 1 1/2 inch pieces; about 11oz, rinsed and drained
3 cups broccoli florets 1 1/2 in pieces; about 8 oz. rinsed and drained
1 lb red bell peppers, rinsed, stemmed, seeded, and cute into 1- by 3-inch strips
2 jars about 6 oz each marinated artichoke hearts
1 can 6oz whole pitted ripe black olives, drained
directions: 1. In a 12x17inch roasting pan, combine carrots, cauliflower, broccoli, bell peppers, and artichoke hearts with their marinade.
2.Roast in a 400 degree oven, stirring every 15 minutes, until carrots are tender to bite, 50-60 minutes.
3.In a large bowl, combine lemon juice, olive oil, vinegar, mustard, and garlic.  Scrape in vegetables, add olives, and stir to coat.  Season to taste with salt and pepper.

name: Hot Fudge Sauce
directions: In heavy small sauce pan melt the Chocolate and butter.
Stir in the Sugar gradually, followed by the evaporated milk continue stirring.
Bring mixture to boiling. Reduce heat but keep it boiling gently for about 8 min. Stirring frequently.
Remove pan from heat and cool slightly. Serve over Ice Cream while hot.

name: Sweet Potato Casserole
directions: Warm potatoes, drain juice; cream butter, eggs and sugar; add milk and cinnamon.
Mash potatoes, add creamed mixture, cook 15 to 20 minutes in a 400 degree oven.
Mix cornflakes, nuts, brown sugar, and 3/4 stick butter and put on top of casserole.
Bake and additional 15 minutes.
(For a 10x14 inch Pyrex baking dish you need 5lbs yams double other ingredients or 3 29-oz cans, one and one-half the other ingredients.

name: Dill Dip
ingredients: 2 tsp Bon Appetite (I used a little celery salt instead)
directions: Mix together.  It tastes even better the next day

name: Cindy's Salad
directions: Mix together mayo and Winger's sauce in small bowl.
Mix lettuce, cut up buffalo chicken, cilantro, corn, and beans together in large salad bowl.
Serve salad with crushed chips on top.  Drizzle dressing mixture on top.

name: Homestyle Baked Scones
directions: In a bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt;  Stir well.  Add 3 cups whipping cream, reserving 1/2 c, add the cranberries; stir just until moist.  Roll the dough out on a floured surface.  Using a round cookie cutter or a glass, cut dough into circles.  Dip tops of unbaked scones in remaining whipping cream and then in sugar.  Place on lightly greased cookie sheets (12 per sheet).  Bake at 425 degrees for 12 to 14 minutes.  Serve warm with butter.  Can also cook in muffin cups.

name: Beef and Broccoli
ingredients: 1/4 cups white grape juice or apple juice
2 cups fresh broccoli florets, stems removed
4 tbsp vegetable or olive oil,  divided
directions: Cut beef steak into 2-inch strips; set aside.  Combine soy sauce, sugar juice, cornstarch and water in a small bowl; set aside.  In a large skillet, stir-fry broccoli in 2 tablespoons oil for about 5 minutes over medium heat.  Do not over cook.  Place broccoli in another dish.  Pour remaining oil in the same skillet and heat on medium-high heat.  Add beef steak and cook until well browned on all sides about 10 minutes.  Add garlic and cook until fragrant, not ore than 1 minute.  Pour soy sauce mixture over meat and cook until slightly thickened.  Stir in sesame oil.  Remove from heat stir in broccoli.  Serve over hot steamed rice.  Makes 8 servings.

name: Sesame Chicken Wraps
directions: Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, and cornstarch in a small bowl; pour over chicken strips and stir to coat.  Set aside for 15 minutes.  In a frying pan, melt butter over low heat.  Add sesame seeds and cook until lightly browned.  Set aside to cool.  In a separate skillet, heat sesame oil over medium heat.  Quickly stir-fry the chicken in the heated oil just until cooked through.  Combine sesame seeds with chicken.  Spoon mixture on lettuce leaves with carrots and zucchini and almonds.

name: Holiday Rice
ingredients: 3 cups uncooked instant rice (or 1 1/2 c real rice)
directions: In a large saucepan, sauté onion in butter over medium-high heat.  Add rice and heat until golden.  Stir in water and salt.  Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes over medium heat.  Remove from heat.  Cover and let stand 20 minutes or until water is absorbed into rice.  Place in serving bowl.  Just before serving, sprinkle parsley and chopped tomatoes over rice.  Makes 8 to 10 servings.

name: Popovers
directions: In a medium bowl, sift together flour and salt; set aside. Place eggs, milk, and butter in a blender and blend briefly.  Add dry ingredients and blend until smooth.  Pour into 12 well-greased muffin cups.  Bake at 400 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes, until popovers raise high and are lightly browned.  Serve hot with butter and jam.  May be cooked, frozen and later reheated at 350 degrees for 5 to 10 minutes.  Makes 12 popovers.

name: Half and Half Wheat Bread
directions: Place 3 cups whole wheat flour, gluten, yeast, brown sugar, and powdered milk in bowl.  Mix together and add warm water.  Mix thoroughly.  Let dough sponge for 10 to 15 minutes.  Then add salt and oil and mix well.  Gradually add the white flour 1/2 c at a time until dough forms a ball and cleans the side of the bowl.  The amount of flour needed may vary.  Knead 5 minutes using a mixer.  If mixing by hand, knead at least 10 minutes for until dough is smooth and elastic.

Preheat oven to 150 degrees during this time.  Lightly oil hands.  Divide dough into two equal portions.  Shape into loaves and place in greased bread pans.  Turn off oven.  Place bread in oven, arranging pans with space between to allow heat to circulate freely.  Let rise until almost double in bulk, approximately 20 to 30 minutes.  Leave bread in oven and turn heat to 350 degrees.  Bake for 30 minutes.  Remove from pans immediately and cool on wire racks.

name: Chicken Tetrazzini
directions: Melt butter mix in flour, salt and pepper for a roux.  Stir in broth and milk gradually.  Cook until thickened.  Add chicken, parmesan cheese and pasta.

name: Dad's Pan Fried Green Beans
directions: Place the green beans in a  large saucepan or pot with one inch of water.  Bring to a boil, cover and cook for 5 minutes, they should still be firm and bright green.
In a small bowl, stir together the soy sauce, balsamic vinegar and sugar; set aside.

Heat the sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat.  Add garlic and cook until starting to brown.  Add the green beans and stir to coat with the oil.  Stir in the soy sauce mixture and simmer for a couple of minutes uncovered to reduce the sauce.  Transfer the beans to a serving dish and pour the sauce over them.

name: Lasagna
directions: Brown beef and drain.  Add spaghetti sauce and heat through.  In a mixing bowl, combine the cheeses, eggs and parsley.  Mix well.  In a 9x13 pan spread 1/3 of meat sauce on bottom.  Lay 4 noodles on top overlapping edges.  Spread 1/3 of cheese mixture on noodles.  Repeat layers, mixing 1/3 of meat sauce into cheese layer.  End with meat sauce on top.  Sprinkle with additional mozzarella and parmesan cheese.  Bake for 1 hour.

name: Hearty Chili
ingredients: 1/2 cups chopped red or green pepper
1 30oz can dark red kidney beans, undrained
2 cloves garlic minced or 1 t garlic salt
directions: Brown ground beef in a large, heavy pan.  Add onions and peppers and cook until tender.  Add remaining ingredients and simmer uncovered over low heat for at least 1 hour.  Chili can be made the day before and reheated.

name: Cubed Beef with Gravy
ingredients: 2 1 oz packages dry onion soup mix
directions: Place stewing beef in a dutch oven or other heavy baking dish.  Sprinkle with dry onion soup mix.  Spoon mushroom soup over top.  Cover with lid of tight foil.  Bake in oven at 325 degrees for about 3 hours.  Stir in mushrooms, if desired, during last 30 minutes of baking.  Pass sour cream for topping individual servings.  Serve over Holiday Rice.  Makes 8 to 10 servings.

name: Popovers
directions: In a medium bowl, sift together flour and salt; set aside. Place eggs, milk, and butter in a blender and blend briefly.  Add dry ingredients and blend until smooth.  Pour into 12 well-greased muffin cups.  Bake at 400 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes, until popovers raise high and are lightly browned.  Serve hot with butter and jam.  May be cooked, frozen and later reheated at 350 degrees for 5 to 10 minutes.  Makes 12 popovers.

name: Holiday Rice
ingredients: 3 cups uncooked instant rice (or 1 1/2 c real rice)
directions: In a large saucepan, sauté onion in butter over medium-high heat.  Add rice and heat until golden.  Stir in water and salt.  Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes over medium heat.  Remove from heat.  Cover and let stand 20 minutes or until water is absorbed into rice.  Place in serving bowl.  Just before serving, sprinkle parsley and chopped tomatoes over rice.  Makes 8 to 10 servings.  Serve with Cubed Beef and Gravy.

name: Chicken Parmesan
directions: Pound chicken breast flat.  Dip in beaten eggs and milk, then roll in bread crumbs.  Saute in butter.  Layer bottom of casserole with sauce, then chicken, then cover each with a slice of each cheese.  Put remaining sauce on top and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and parsley flakes.  Bake for 1 hour at 350 covered.  Uncover last 15 minutes of baking.  Makes 8 servings.

name: Beef Cubed Steaks with Potatoes and Gravy
ingredients: 2 large cans cream of mushroom soup
directions: Form ground beef into 8 thick square patties.  In a large skillet, melt butter or oil over medium heat.  Brown patties for about 10 minutes on each side.  Add onion and continue cooking over medium heat for 5 minutes.  Place patties, onions, and drippings in a greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish.  Spoon cream of mushroom soup over top.  Cover with loose foil.  Wrap potatoes in foil and place on a baking sheet.  Bake both meat and potatoes for 1 1/2 hours at 350 degrees.  To serve, spoon gravy from cooked steaks over baked potatoes.  Makes 8 servings.

name: Whole Wheat Quick Bread
directions: In a bowl, combine egg, buttermilk, molasses or honey, and butter.  In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, salt, and baking powder.  Stir well; add to first mixture and mix well.  Pour into a greased loaf pan.  Bake 400 degrees for about 45 to 50 minutes, until lightly brown.  Cool slightly, then turn out of the pan onto a wire rack.  Slice while warm.  Makes 1 loaf.

name: Beehive Honey Butter
directions: Combine all and whip for about 3 minutes.  Store in fridge.

name: Granola
ingredients: 1/2 cups pecans or walnuts, coarsely chopped
directions: In a large bowl, mix together oats, brown sugar, coconut, almonds, and pecans or walnuts; set aside.  In a saucepan, stir together water, oil, honey, and peanut butter; bring to a boil.  Remove from heat; add vanilla and stir honey mixture into oats mixture.  Spread on a large greased baking sheet.  Bake at 325 degrees for about 45 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Makes about 2 pounds.

name: Lemon chicken Italiano
directions: Pound chicken until flat.  Coat with flour.  Melt butter and oil in skillet.  Cook chicken for about 5 minutes each side.  Season to taste.  Place marinara sauce in bottom of casserole dish.  Top with Chicken.  Place chicken in a 250 degree oven to keep warm.
To make lemon sauce, melt 4 T of butter in same skillet.  Add onion and sauté until tender.  Remove from heat.  Add lemon juice and parsley.  Pour hot sauce over chicken and serve.  Makes 6 servings.

name: Sloppy Joes
directions: Brown ground beef and drain fat.  Sprinkle with salt.  Add chopped onion and cook until tender.  Stir in ketchup, tomato soup, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, and brown sugar.  Simmer 30 minutes.  Serve on buns.  Makes 12 servings.

name: Banana Crumb Muffins
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease 10 muffin cups, or line with muffin papers.

In a large bowl, mix together 1 1/2 cups flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt. In another bowl, beat together bananas, sugar, egg and melted butter. Stir the banana mixture into the flour mixture just until moistened. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups.
In a small bowl, mix together brown sugar, 2 tablespoons flour and cinnamon. Cut in 1 tablespoon butter until mixture resembles coarse cornmeal. Sprinkle topping over muffins.
Bake in preheated oven for 18 to 20 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into center of a muffin comes out clean.

name: Banana Carrot Snacking Cake
directions: Smash bananas.  Stir in oil, sugar, carrots, pineapple and vanilla.  Mix in flour, soda, cinnamon, allspice and salt.  Pour into a greased 9x13 pan and bake at 350 for 35-40 minutes.  Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

name: Toffee Cake
directions: Bake cake for 9x13 pan.  Cool on wire rack 5 min. Poke holes in cake - not all the way through.

In sauce pan over low heat, combine sweetened condensed milk and caramel, stir until smooth and blended.  Slowly pour the warm mixture over top of warm cake.  Let sink into the holes; then sprinkle crushed chocolate toffee chunks across entire cake while still warm.
Let cake cool completely then top with whipped topping.  Decorate the top of cake with more toffee and swirls of caramel.  Refrigerate and serve right from the pan

name: Broccoli Salad
directions: Mix all ingredients.

name: Holly cookies
directions: Melt margarine slowly in large kettle, add marshmallows and stir until melted; then add lemon extract and green food coloring to please you. Stir well.
Remove from stove and add corn flakes.  Mix well until flakes are well covered.  Drop by teaspoonful onto waxed paper and decorate with 2 or 3 red candies.

name: Mini Burgers
ingredients: 8 3 inch buns or rolls, split in half
directions: Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F. Preheat a griddle to 350 degrees F.
Combine the onion powder, garlic powder, pepper, and salt in a small bowl. Set aside.

Line a jellyroll or sheet pan with parchment paper, and place the ground chuck in the middle of the pan. Cover the meat with a large sheet of plastic wrap. Roll meat with a rolling pin until it covers the surface of the pan; it should be very thin. Remove the plastic wrap, and sprinkle the meat with the seasoning mixture. Fold the meat in half, from side to side, using the parchment paper. Use a pizza wheel to cut the meat into 8 even squares.
Wrap the buns in foil and place in the oven for 5 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, place the burgers on the griddle and cook for 2 to 3 minutes per side.
Remove the buns from the oven. Spread a small amount of mayonnaise on each bun and top with the burger and any other condiments, as desired. Serve immediately.

name: Oriental Salad
directions: Mix soup seasoning packet, oil, vinegar, sugar salt and pepper
Shred cabbage, add onions.  Break up noodles and add to cabbage.
Mix in dressing

name: Microwave Caramels
directions: Add all ingredients but vanilla into large microwave bowl.  Mix well and cook 6-8 minutes (6 1/2 is just right for 1000 watt microwave)
Add 1/2 tsp vanilla.  Pour in to buttered 8x8 pan to cool.
Cut into squares when cool.

name: Cheesecake Brownies
directions: Line a 9x9 pan with aluminum foil and spread 1 T melted butter in pan and brushed on sides.

Melt chocolate and butter, stirring occasionally.  Whisk in sugar and vanilla.  Remove pan from heat.  Beat in eggs one at a time.  Add flour and stir well.  Turn batter to pan, smooth top, set aside.

Beat cream cheese until soft.  Add sugar, cocoa, vanilla and beat.  Add flour and eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.  Pour over brownie layer and smooth top.  Marble slightly, smooth top.  Bake for 40 minutes and let cool.

name: Honey Mustard Chicken
ingredients: 4 chicken breasts flattened to 1/4 inch thick
directions: Dip chicken in honey/2 T mustard mix and then in bread crumbs/1 T mustard mix.  Melt butter in pan and cook chicken for 8 minutes.

name: MJ's Apple Pie
directions: Shred Apples, put tapioca and some sugar in bottom of pie crust. Put apples in and more sugar.  Top with pats of butter and cinnamon.
We have added cardamom before.
Cook pie according to crust recipe.

name: Fudge
directions: Mix milk, sugar, salt and butter in heavy sauce pan.  Stir constantly.  Bring to a boil-continue 8 minutes.  Add water and marshmallows to mixture.  Melt remove from heat.  Mix in chocolate chips.  Pour into greased 9x9 pan and chill.

name: Grandma's Best Homemade Bread
directions: Combine yeast, ginger, 1 t sugar with 3/4 c hot water.  Set aside and allow to double in size.
Combine milk, cooking oil, 1/4 c sugar, salt, egg and 1 c hot water into a large mixing bowl.  Add yeast mixture.  Stir gently.

Gradually sift in 5 cups flour, stirring to mix.  Pour out onto a floured board to knead.  Add at least 1 more cup of flour and more if needed.  Place into a greased bowl, cover and let rise till doubled.  Knead again and mold into greased bread pans.  Let rise.  Cook in a 350 degree pre heated oven for 25 to 30 minutes.

name: Cheesy Potatoes
ingredients: 10 medium potatoes, cooked and grated. Boil with skins on.
directions: Grate potatoes into 2 medium or 1 very large baking pan.  Mix soup, sour cream, cheese, melted butter, onions and fold into potatoes.  Top with bread crumbs.  Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

name: Hay Stacks
directions: Mix cream of chicken soup and milk for gravy over haystacks.  Layer rice, noodles, chicken and other toppings.

name: Seven Layer Dip
directions: layer 1-refried beans and taco seasoning
layer 2-guacamole
layer 3-sour cream, mayo, salt and pepper
layer 4-grated cheddar
layer 5-olives
layer 6-green onions
layer 7-tomatoes
Serve with tortilla chips.

name: Mandarin Salad
directions: In a small pan over medium heat, cook almonds and sugar, stirring until sugar is dissolved.  Cool almonds totally.  Mix dressing and chill.  Top lettuce with celery, onions, bacon, oranges, and almonds.  Serve with dressing.

name: Apricot chicken
directions: Mix dressing, jam, curry and soup mix.  Pour over chicken.  Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes.

name: Applebee's Club House Grill
directions: Spread the butter evenly over one side of each slice of bread.
Put one slice of bread, butter side down, into a preheated frying pan over medium heat.
Spread the mayonnaise over the unbuttered side of the grilling bread.
Sprinkle some of the Cheddar cheese over the mayonnaise.
Lay 2 slices each of the turkey and ham in the pan next to the bread for about 30 seconds to heat up.
When it is warm, lay the turkey on the cheese.
Place tomato slices on the turkey.
Spread the barbecue sauce over the tomato slices.
Lay 2 slices of ham on the tomatoes.
Sprinkle more cheese on over the ham.
top off the sandwich with the other slice of bread, being sure that the buttered side is facing up.
By now the first side of the bread should be golden brown.  Flip the sandwich over and grill the other side for 2 to 3 minutes or until golden brown as well.
Remove the sandwich from the pan and cut in half diagonally.
Serve with additional BBQ sauce on the side.
Let sandwich sit for 5 min before eating if you can resist.

name: Applebee's Pizza Sticks
ingredients: 2 to 4 cups vegetable oil for frying
3 oz Italian sausage cooked and crumbled (optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.

Prepare the dipping sauce by combining tomato sauce tomato diced onion sugar dried oregano salt and dried basil in a small, uncovered saucepan and bringing the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer the sauce for 1/2 hour.

Prepare the pizza sticks by first proofing the dough.  Shape it into a rectangle that is longer from left to right than top to bottom.  With a sharp knife or pizza cutter, slice through the middle of the dough lengthwise.  This will divide the rectangle into two thinner rectangles that will measure 4 to 5 inches from top to bottom.
Slice the dough from top to bottom into 1 1/2 inch wide pieces.  You should have somewhere between 20 and 24 dough slices.
Place the slices onto a greased cookie sheet about 1/2 inch apart and bake for 3 minutes.  You may have to use more than one cookie sheet.  This will proof the dough so that it becomes stiff.
Heat vegetable oil in a frying pan or deep fryer to 350 degrees F.  Oil should at least be 1/2 inch deep if using a stovetop pan.  You will want to use more oil with a deep fryer.
Fry pizza sticks 5 to 6 at a time for about 1 minute per side or until they are a dark golden brown.  Remove them from the oil onto a cloth or paper towel to drain.
When all the pizza dough sticks are fired, arrange them once again on the cookie sheet(s).  you may want to line the cookie sheets with foil to make cleanup easier.  Preheat the broiler.
Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese evenly over the dough.
Sprinkle the Parmesan cheese evenly over the mozzarella.

Combine the oregano, basil, caraway seed, and garlic salt in a small bowl.  If your oregano and basil are fairly coarse you can use your thumb and first finger to crunch the spice up a little, making it a finer blend.
Sprinkle the spice mixture over the cheese.
If you want to make the "loaded" variety, sprinkle the pepperoni and sausage over the top of the pizza sticks.
Broil the pizza sticks for 2 minutes or until the cheese is melted.  Serve hot with dipping sauce on the side.

name: Raspberry-Pineapple Sherbet
directions: Let sherbet and raspberries soften slightly.  Place sherbet in a plastic container and stir well.  Stir in bananas.  Gently add raspberries.  Cover and freeze.  Serve as a sherbet or as a slush by adding ginger ale or soda to desired consistency.  Makes about 12 servings.

name: Avocado salsa
directions: Mix all in small bowl.  Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour.  Serve with Chicken Tostadas.

name: Hot Spinach Artichoke Dip
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups thawed, chopped frozen artichoke hearts
1 large family size box wheat thins
directions: Boil spinach and artichokes in 1 cup of water until tender and drain. Discard liquid. Heat cream cheese in microwave for 1 minute or until hot and soft. Stir in rest of ingredients and serve hot.

name: Broiled Tilapia Parmesan
directions: Preheat your oven's broiler. Grease a broiling pan or line pan with aluminum foil.
In a small bowl, mix together the Parmesan cheese, butter, mayonnaise and lemon juice. Season with dried basil, pepper, onion powder and celery salt. Mix well and set aside.

Arrange fillets in a single layer on the prepared pan. Broil a few inches from the heat for 2 to 3 minutes. Flip the fillets over and broil for a couple more minutes. Remove the fillets from the oven and cover them with the Parmesan cheese mixture on the top side. Broil for 2 more minutes or until the topping is browned and fish flakes easily with a fork. Be careful not to over cook the fish.

name: Creamy Italian Chicken
directions: Combine salad dressing mix and water and pour over chicken.  Cover and cook at 200 degrees for 3 1/2 to 4 hours.  Mix soup, cream cheese and pour over chicken thin with water if necessary.  Cook at 300 degrees for 1/2 hour.  Serve over rice or noodles.

name: Swiss Chicken
directions: Arrange chicken in a glass dish.  Season with salt and pepper.  Cover each chicken with cheese and stuffing.  Combine soup, butter and water.  Pour over stuffing and chicken.  Cover and bake for 50 to 60 minutes.

name: Southwestern White Chili
source: from Better Homes & Garden's Biggest Book of Slow Cooker Recipes
ingredients: 1 cups Chopped Onion (1/4 C. dehydrated onions)
3 15 1/2 ounce cans great northern (white) beans, drained and rinsed (1 lb. (2-1/2 C.) dried white beans, cooked and rinsed)
2 4 ounce cans diced green chili peppers
3 cups chopped cooked chicken (3 10 oz. cans of chicken-you can also use the water from the can as part of your chicken broth)
2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese (8 ounces)
directions: 1. In a 3 1/2 to 6-quart slow cooker place the onion, garlic, cumin, oregano, red pepper, beans 2 cans chili peppers, broth and cooked chicken. Stir to combine.
2. Cover and cook on low heat setting for 7 to 8 hours or on high-heat setting for 3 1/2 to 4 hours. Stir in the cheese until melted.
3. Ladle the chili into 8 bowls. If desired, top with sour cream and sprinkle with additional chili peppers or chives.

name: Anell's Famous Corn Bread
ingredients: 1 cups . buttermilk (3 T. dry powdered milk + 1 C. Water and 1 T. lemon juice or vinegar, let sit for 5-10 minutes before adding to the recipe)
1 cups . flour (half and half or all-purpose)
2 eggs (2 T. Dehydrated egg powder + 1/4 C. Water)
directions: Melt butter; add to the sugar and stir well. Add eggs and beat until well blended. Combine buttermilk and soda and stir into sugar-egg-butter mixture. Add cornmeal, flour, and salt and stir until just blended. Pour into greased 8-inch square pan. Bake at 375 degrees about 30 minutes or until it begins to pull away from sides of pan. Serve piping hot with butter and honey.
Note: For glass pan, reduce heat to 350 degrees.

name: Whole Wheat Pumpkin Bread
ingredients: 3 egg whites (or 2 T. dryPowdered Egg + 1/4 C. Water)
1/2 cups fat-free milk (1-1/2 T. Dry Powdered Milk + 1/2 C. Water)
directions: Directions:

PREHEAT oven to 350ºF. Grease a nonstick 9x5-inch loaf pan; set aside. Mix pumpkin, 1 cup granulated sugar, the brown sugar, 3 of the egg whites, milk and oil in large bowl. Add flour, baking powder, pie spice and salt; stir just until moistened.
SPOON the pumpkin batter into prepared pan.

BAKE 1 hour to 1 hour 5 min. or until wooden toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Run knife or thin spatula around edges of pan to loosen bread; cool in pan on wire rack 10 min. Remove bread from pan to wire rack; cool completely.

name: HAM AND CHEESE ROLLS
ingredients: 1 batch of bread recipe/ or 1 loaf Rhodes frozen dough, thawed
8 oz . ham or turkey thinly sliced
1/2 lb . shredded cheese (Jarlsberg is our family's favorite, but cheddar or whatever you have works great!)
directions: Roll out dough in a rectangle as you would for cinnamon rolls. Spread mustard-honey mixture on dough, leaving 1/2 inch along edges. Lay meat slices on dough and sprinkle with cheese. Roll up jelly-roll style. Slice into 10-12 equal slices with a sharp knife. Place in greased muffin tin (for gourmet look) or place on greased cookie sheet (for easier clean up, use Reynolds non-stick Release foil--then you don't even have to grease it!). Let rise until double, about 45 mins-1 hour. Bake 400 degrees for 10 minutes until light brown. They can be baked at a lower temperature, for a longer time, as you would a loaf of bread, just watch them carefully! Serve warm, or at room temperature. Great for a picnic!

Cooks Note: Due to the ingredients, these rolls must remain refrigerated after baking, until they are consumed. Often, I will wrap the leftovers in individual sandwich bags and freeze them. They will thaw in a lunch box and be ready to eat while staying cool until lunchtime. Once thawed they can be warmed up in a microwave easily for 15-30 seconds, and re-melt the cheese all over again!

name: Sneaky Creamy Oatmeal
ingredients: 2 tbsp . Sugar (You can decrease this according to your family's tastes)
directions: Mix first 3 dry ingredients together in empty #10 can and store covered in a cool, dry place.
Making Creamy Oatmeal from the Sneaky Oatmeal Mix (Makes 1 serving)
1/2 C. Oatmeal Mix
1 C. Water
Small handful of Raisins (Optional) You could also use dehydrated apples from the cannery just break them into smaller pieces.

Mix Oatmeal mix and raisins (or other dehydrated fruit) with water and microwave for 2 minutes. If you need to make more of this for a larger family, simply boil the water first in a pot on the stove and then stir in the oats and let sit for 1 minute.

name: Twinkie Surprise Cupcakes
source: Runner up in the Utah's Own Down Home Cook Off (Everyday Food Storage)
ingredients: 1 Box Yellow or Devil's Food CakeMix
1 cups . Pureed Pumpkin (like what you get in the can)
3 Regular Eggs (or 4 T. Powdered Eggs + 1/2 C. Water)
directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line cupcake trays with cupcake liners.
2. In a large bowl, mix the cake mix, summer yellow squash puree, water, oil, eggs, and sour cream. Beat until smooth, 1-2 minutes.
3. Fill cupcake liners 1/3 of the way. Dot each with raspberry jam, then cover with batter until the cups are 3/4 filled.

4. Bake until the tops of the cupcakes are golden and spring back to the touch, about 20-25 minutes.  Turn the cupcakes onto wire rack to cool.  Once they are cooled, frost with vanilla frosting, if desired.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
directions: Mix butter, sugars, vanilla, and eggs in large bowl.  Stir in flour, baking soda, and salt.  Stir in chocolate chips.  Drop by rounded tablespoon on ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes.
Dough can also be frozen in balls and bake for same time.

name: Sweet and sour pork
ingredients: 3 lb lean pork cut into strips
2 20oz cans pineapple tidbits, drained with juice reserved
1 1/2 cups red or green bell pepper, cut in strips
directions: Melt butter in a large skillet; add olive oil.  Stir-fry pork strips until browned, about 10 minutes.  Cover and simmer on low for about 30 minutes.  Drain meat and set aside.

In same skillet, combine  cornstarch, salt, pepper, brown sugar, vinegar, 2 cups of the reserved pineapple juice, and soy sauce.  Cook and stir until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat. Stir and cook 2 minutes.  Add hot pork, peppers, sliced onion, and pineapple tidbits.  Cook 3 minutes longer over medium heat.  Serve over rice.

name: Golden Honey Pan Rolls
directions: In bread machine pan, place the first eight ingredients in order suggested by manufacturer.  Select dough setting.  When cycle is completed, turn dough onto a lightly floured surface.  Punch down; cover and let rest for 10 minutes.  Divide into 24 pieces; shape each into a ball.  Place 12 balls each in two greased 8 inch baking pans.  Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled about 30 minutes.  For glaze, combine sugar, butter, honey and egg white; drizzle over dough.  Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.  Brush with additional honey if desired.

name: Cranberry Biscuits
directions: In bread machine pan place first 10 ingredients.  Select dough setting.  Just before final kneading add cranberries.  When cycle is completed, turn dough out.  Cover and let rest for 15 minutes.  Roll or pat into 1/2 in thickness.  Cut with a 2 1/2 in biscuit cutter.  Place in a greased 15 by 10 baking pan.  Cover and let rise in a warm place until almost doubled about 40 minutes.  Bake at 375 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.  Combine powdered sugar and enough orange juice to achieve a glaze consistency.  Drizzle over warm biscuits.  Sprinkle with chopped cranberries.

name: Cucumber fruit salad
ingredients: 1 medium cucumber, peeled, seeded and diced
directions: In a bowl, combine the cucumber, apple and grapes.  In a small bowl, combine the sour cream, sugar and parsley.  Pour over cucumber mixture and toss to coat.  Stir in walnuts if desired.  Serve immediately.

name: Sour Cream Lemon Bread
directions: In a measuring cup, combine sour cream and lemon juice.  Add enough milk to measure 1/2 cup.  In bread machine pan, place the sour cream mixture, butter, egg, lemon peel, sugar, salt, baking soda, flour and yeast.  Select sweet bread setting.  Choose crust color and loaf size.  Bake.  In mixing bowl, beat spread ingredients until smooth; serve with the bread.

name: Creamy Fruit Salad
directions: In a bowl, combine oranges, peaches, pineapple and marshmallows.  In a small mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese, yogurt and sugar until smooth; pour over fruit and toss to coat. Refrigerate for 15 minutes.

name: Polynesian Sausage Supper
ingredients: 1 lb fully cooked smoked sausage, cut into 1/2-inch slices
1 medium green pepper, cut into 1 inch chunks
directions: In a skillet, cook the sausage, onion and green pepper until the sausage is lightly browned; drain.  Add tomatoes, broth, brown sugar, garlic powder and pepper.  Drain pineapple, reserving juice.  Stir pineapple into sausage mixture.  Bring to a boil; cook, uncovered, for 5 minutes.
Combine cornstarch and reserved pineapple juice until smooth; gradually add to sausage mixture.  Bring to a boil; cook and stir fr 2 minutes or until thickened.  Serve over rice.

name: Zucchini Manicotti
directions: Cook manicotti.  Rinse in cold water and drain.  in a large bowl, combine 2 cups of mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, parsley, salt, pepper and nutmeg.  Stir in the egg, sour cream, dressing and zucchini.  Carefully stuff manicotti.  Place in a 13 by 9 greased baking dish.  Pour spaghetti sauce over top.  Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.  Sprinkle with remaining mozzarella.  Bake 5 minutes longer or until heated through.

name: Cheesy Chicken
directions: Place 1 T of butter in a microwave safe casserole dish; set aside.  Combine cracker crumbs and pepper.  Dip chicken in remaining butter, the spread with sour cream.  Roll in the crumb mixture. Place in prepared dish.  cover loosely and microwave on high for 6-7 minutes or until chicken juices run clear.  Let stand for 5-10 minutes before serving.

name: Southwest Stuffed Chicken
ingredients: 6 oz Monterey jack cheese cut into 2 inch by 1/2 inch sticks
directions: Flatten chicken to 1/8 in thickness.  Place a cheese stick down the middle of each; top with chilies.  Roll up and tuck in ends.  Secure with a toothpick. In a shallow bowl, combine the bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, chili powder, salt and cumin.  Coat chicken with flour, then dip in butter and roll in crumb mixture.
Place roll-ups, seam side down, in a greased 9x13 pan.  Bake uncovered at 400 degrees for 25 minutes.

name: Chicken Potato Bake
ingredients: 1 lb red potatoes cut into chunks
directions: Place chicken in greased 9x13 pan.  Arrange potatoes around chicken.  Drizzle with dressing; sprinkle with Italian seasoning and Parmesan cheese.  Cover and bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.  Uncover and bake 20 to 30 minutes longer or until potatoes are tender and chicken juices run clear.

name: Sloppy Joe Cheeseburger
directions: Saute hamburger and onions.  Drain.  Add remaining ingredients and simmer for 15 minutes.  Serve on toasted hamburger buns.  This filling may be frozen and reheated.

name: Shortbread kisses
directions: Cream butter and add sugar.  Beat until light and fluffy.  Add flour and mix well.  Roll into 1 1/2 inch balls.  Bake at 325 degrees for about 30 minutes.  Cookies will brown on bottom and look a bit dry and cracked on top.  As soon as the cookies are removed from the oven put one unwrapped Hershey's kiss in the middle of each cookie.

name: Homemade Oreos
directions: Mix cake, shortening and eggs together.  Roll dough into balls.  Placed on an ungreased baking sheet.  Bake at 350 degrees for 7 minutes.
Filling mix 4 remaining ingredients well.  When cookies are cool, spread a layer of filling between 2 cookies.  Keep refrigerated.

name: Chocolate Chip Muffins
directions: In a large bowl coming first 4 ingredients.  In a small bowl, beat egg, milk and oil.  Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened.  Fold in chocolate chips.  Fill greased or paper lined muffin pan 3/4 full.  Bake at 400 degrees for 18 to 20 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean.  cool  for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack.

name: Hamburgers
directions: Cook patties and serve with buns and toppings.

name: Hot Dogs
directions: Cook hot dogs and serve with buns and toppings.

name: Tacos
directions: Cook hamburger meat and add taco seasoning.  Serve with tortillas and toppings.

name: Chicken Enchilada soup
directions: In a soup pot, saute onion in corn oil over high heat until onion are translucent but not browned.  Add all remaining ingredients except cheese, tortillas and paprika.  Add water?  Bring to a light boil.  Cover, reduce heat and simmer about 20 minutes.  Meanwhile, cut tortillas into 1/2 inch strips and set aside.  Reduce heat of soup to 150 degrees.  Add cheese and stir as it melts.  Do not boil.  Add tortilla strips gradually to prevent them from sticking together.  When tortillas are softened, the soup is ready to serve.  Garnish with paprika.

name: Chicken Curry for Crockpot (Yellow Chicken)
directions: Cut chicken into small pieces and put in crock pot.  Add rest of ingredients.  Cook on high 2 1/2 to 4 hours or low 6 to 8 hours.  Serve over hot rice or mashed potatoes. Serves 4.

name: Zucchini Soup
ingredients: 1 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
directions: In a large stock pot saute zucchini, celery, carrots and onion in margarine, until done (approximately 20 minutes).
In a small mixing bowl combine flour and milk. Mix until smooth and then add to stock pot.
Cook soup until thickened and then puree in a blender or food processor until smooth and creamy.
Pour pureed soup back into stock pot and add cream of mushroom soup, water, bouillon cubes and sour cream. Simmer until heated through and then serve.

name: Red Pepper Italian Sandwiches
directions: Mix mayonnaise and Italian dressing. Layer the ingredients into sandwiches; spread mayo mixture on both sides of the bread. Wrap in foil and bake at 350 for 15 minutes.
You can either buy canned roasted red peppers or make them yourself.

name: Chicken Taco Soup
directions: In a large pot, bring water to a boil; dissolve bouillon cubes.  Reduce heat to low. Stir in cubed chicken, cumin, chili powder, tomatoes, sugar, rice, and garbanzo beans.  Simmer for about 1 hour.  When ready to serve, add remaining ingredients as toppings to individual servings.

name: Chicken Tostadas
ingredients: 2 tbsp vegetable oil, plus more for cooking tortillas
directions: Cook chicken in oil.  Add garlic and cook for about 30 seconds until fragrant.  Add green chilies and sour cream; stir well.  Cook over low heat until hot.   Serve taco style with Avocado Salsa.

name: Fiesta Rice
directions: In a saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat.  Sauté onion, garlic, and green pepper until the onion is translucent. Add the rice and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until rice is golden.  Add tomatoes and broth to rice; bring to a boil.  Cover and simmer 20 minutes.  Allow to stand 5 to 10 minutes before serving.

name: Fried Ice Cream
ingredients: 2 tsp cinnamon, plus some for topping
directions: At least a day in advance, remove ice cream from freezer and thaw at room temperature for 1 0 minutes.  Peel ice cream from carton. With a knife, cut ice cream in half and then fourths, making either slices.  Quickly shape into 8 balls. Sprinkle each ice cream ball with cinnamon and roll in crushed corn flakes. Place on a tray and freeze until very hard.

On serving day, place individual serving bowls in freezer to chill. Heat enough oil in deep frying pan to cover ice cream balls. Heat to 375 degrees and fry each ball one at a time for 3 to 5 seconds. Always use caution when deep frying. Top with honey, whipped cream, and a sprinkle of cinnamon.  Serve immediately.  Makes 8 ice cream balls.

name: Beef Fajitas
ingredients: 1 green bell pepper, sliced into strips
1 red bell pepper, sliced into strips
directions: In a large skillet, stir-fry beef in hot oil over medium heat until cooked through, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.  Add onion, ,peppers, garlic, and lemon or lime juice  and cook for about 2 minutes. Cover ands et aside.  Serve taco style.  Makes 12 fajitas.

name: Grandchildren's Popcorn
directions: Pop popcorn in the microwave; set aside.  With a grown-up's help, melt butter in a large saucepan over low heat.  Add marshmallows; stir until melted. Remove from heat.  Add popped popcorn and stir until coated.  Spread out on a piece of waxed paper to cool.  You can also form into popcorn balls.

name: Chocolate Mint Brownies
directions: In a large bowl, cream together sugars and butter until fluffy.  Beat in eggs until well blended; set aside.  In a small bowl, microwave baking chocolate for 1 minute.  Stir and continue to heat at 10 second intervals just until melted.  Add melted chocolate to the sugar and butter mixture.  Add vanilla.  In a separate bowl, stir together flour and baking powder; add to creamed mixture and mix well.  Spread batter into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish and bake at 325 degrees for about 25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out with a few fudgy crumbs.  When brownies are cool, frost with Mint frosting and refrigerate for an hour.  Drizzle Chocolate glaze over frosting before serving.  Makes about 15 brownies.
Try baking in a sheet cake pan.

name: Mint Frosting
directions: Mix butter, milk, peppermint extract, and food coloring together.  Add powdered sugar and mix well.
Use with the Chocolate Mint Brownie Recipe.

name: Chocolate Glaze
directions: Microwave butter and chocolate chips together on high power for one minute.  Add vanilla and stir.  Randomly drizzle glaze over frosted brownies.
Use with Chocolate Mint Brownies and Mint Frosting.

name: Potato Alfredo
ingredients: 8 potatoes , peeled and cut in thick strips(French-fry style)
4 cloves garlic, minced, or 2 t garlic salt
directions: Place potato strips in a large baking dish.  Combine all other ingredients in a medium bowl; pour over potatoes. Bake uncovered at 400 degrees for about 1 hour until potatoes are tender.  Makes about 8 servings.

name: Holiday Hot Chocolate
directions: In a saucepan, combine sugar, cocoa, and salt; add water. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture boils.  Boil and stir 2 minutes. Stir in milk and evaporated milk and heat.  Do not boil. Remove from heat and add vanilla.  Pour into a thermos for easy serving.  Makes 8 cups.

name: Cookies and Cream Cheesecake
ingredients: 3 cups finely crushed Oreo cookies (36 cookies divided)
1 cups whipping cream, plus sugar to sweeten
1 In a bowl, stir together the 2 cups crushed Oreos and butte or margarine. Press into the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate or spring form pan.  Freeze or refrigerate until firm.
directions: In a large bow, beat cream cheese until fluffy. Gradually add sugar and vanilla.  Blend well. Whip and sweeten cream; fold whipped cream and remaining 1 cup crushed Oreos into cream cheese mixture. Spoon into chilled crust. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving. Garnish with chocolate bar shavings.  Makes about 6 to 8 servings.

name: Coconut cream dessert
ingredients: 2 cups whipping cream, plus sugar to sweeten
3 3oz packages coconut cream instant pudding mix
directions: To prepare crust, combine flour and the 2 table spoons sugar in a medium bowl. Cut in butter until crumbly. Stir in pecans. Press mixture into a greased 9x13 baking dish.  Bake at 325 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until edges are lightly browned.

Beat cream cheese and powdered sugar in a small bowl until smooth. Whip and sweeten cream. Fold half of whipped cream into cream cheese mixture.  Spread over the crust.  In a bowl, whisk milk and pudding mixes for 2 minutes.  Let stand for 2 minutes or until soft-set. Spread over cream cheese mixture. Top with remaining whipped cream.
Toast coconut by spreading it on a large baking sheet and toasting to 325 degrees for about 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle over dessert. Refrigerate overnight. Makes 12 to 16 servings.

name: Sour Cream Chili Bake
directions: Cook ground beef and onion until meat is browned and onion is tender; drain. Stir in beans, tomato sauce, taco seasoning, corn, onion and ¾ C. cheese. Sprinkle 2 ½ cups Fritos in bottom of 8x8 baking dish. Cover with Chili. Bake at 350 degree for 20-25 minutes. Spread sour cream of chili. Top with remaining corn chips and cheese. Bake 3-4 minutes longer.

name: Broiled Meatball Sandwiches
directions: Cook meatballs in sauce.  Spoon several meatballs on to toasted sliced hard rolls.  Cover with slice of provolone cheese and then broil until cheese is melted.

name: Cake Mix Cinnamon Rolls
directions: Mix together cake mix, yeast, 2 C flour, salt, and water.  Mix in remaining flour.  Rise for 1 hour

Pour onto floured surface (Sticky dough use generous amounts of flour) Knead and add small amounts of flour until dough is workable.  Roll into rectangle.  Butter Surfaces.  Sprinkle with Cinnamon and Sugar.  Raisins Optional.  Sprinkle with 2 grated orange peels and 3/4 C sugar.
Roll into log.  Cut 1" thick.   Raise in greaes pan 30 min.  Bake 350 for 20 min.  Frost while warm.

name: Orange Bread
directions: Mix together all but powdered sugar and orange juice
Bake at 350 for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Mix juice of 1 orange and 1/2 cup powdered sugar and ice.

name: Snickerdoodles
directions: Mix all  but 2 T sugar and cinnamon and roll in balls and put in 2 T sugar.
Bake 7-10 minutes at 400 degrees

name: Gingersnaps
directions: Mix together and roll in sugar
Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes

name: Oatmeal Pancake Mix
directions: Mix all dry ingredients together well.  Store in a sealed gallon-size zipper storage bag.
To make pancakes (Use 2 cups of dry mix):

Beat eggs in a large bowl.  Gradually beat in 1/3 c oil.  Alternately add pancake mix and water to mixture. Blend well.  Cook on griddle or in frying pan.  Serve with your favorite topping.  This mix makes a great gift.  If given as a gift, be sure to include a card printed with the recipe.

name: Wheat Chili
directions: In a covered baking dish or crockpot, put wheat, water and salt.  Bake at 250 degrees for 4 hours (or on high for 4 hours in crockpot).  Add uncooked rice and cook one more hour.  Saute hamburger, onions and green peppers until meat it done.  Add the rest of the ingredients except for the cheese.  Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes (in crockpot continue on high for 15 minutes).  Sprinkle with cheese and bake 15 minutes more uncovered (covered in crockpot).  Add a little water if too thick before you add cheese.
This reheats very well.  If too thick, add a bit more water or an 8oz can tomato sauce and 1 can of water.

name: Cottage Cheese Beef Stroganoff
source: Basic Food Storage Cookbook (the yellow one)
ingredients: 1 10 oz can cream of mushroom soup
directions: In skillet, brown ground beef with bacon.  Add onion and cook until tender but not brown.  Drain off excess fat.  Add salt, basil, paprika, garlic and pepper.  Stir in soup and cook slowly, uncovered, 20 minutes stirring frequently.  Blend cottage cheese in blender until smooth.  Stir into stroganoff sauce and heat, but do not boil.  Serve meat sauce over hot, buttered noodles.

name: Beef Enchiladas
ingredients: 1 can chili con carne without beans
directions: Mix sauce (everything above hamburger) together in saucepan.  Simmer on low heat for 30 minutes.

Brown ground beef in skillet.  Add tomato sauce, taco seasoning, red pepper, oregano, and Tabasco sauce.  Mix thoroughly.  Divide beef mixture and spoon onto each tortilla.  Sprinkle cheese and ground onions over the beef mixture and roll up tortillas.  Place seam side down in baking dish.  Pour sauce over top.  Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.  Sprinkle with additional cheese just before serving.

name: Potatoes Au Gratin
directions: Dice cooked potatoes.  Melt the butter in a saucepan and stir in the flour and seasonings.  Cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture bubbles.  Gradually add the milk, and cook over low heat, stirring constantly until the sauce boils and thickens.  Stir in 3/4 c grated cheese and the diced potatoes.  Turn into a baking dish, top with the rest of the cheese, and bake 375 degrees about 15 minutes, until the cheese melts and browns.

name: Old-fashioned filled cookies
directions: Cream butter.  Add sugar and egg, and beat until fluffy.  Sift flour, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg.  Add to creamed mixture alternately with milk.  Add vanilla.  Chill dough for one hour in refrigerator.
Prepare raisin filling by combining raisins, water, sugar, chopped nuts and lemon juice in a small sauce pan and cook on low until thick, stirring constantly.  Cool.

Roll out dough to 1/4 inch thick.  Cut with a round cookie cutter approx. 3 inches in diameter.  Cut 2 rounds for each cookie.  Place about 1 t raisin filling in center of a round, and top with a second round.  Press edges together with fingers or a fork.  Prick top with fork.  Place on greased cookie sheet and bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until done.

name: Sloppy Joses
directions: Brown ground beef add refried beans, green chilies, salsa, onion, water and garlic.  Serve with buns and other toppings as desired.

name: Pork Barbacoa
directions: 1-Sprinkle roast all over with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
2-Place in crockpot and cook on low for 7-8 hours.
3-After cooking, take roast out and shred.
4-Place back into crockpot.
5-Add the enchilada sauce and brown sugar and let it heat through.
6-Make burritos with pork and cover with sauce/cheese and heat in oven.

name: CILANTRO-LIME RICE
directions: In a saucepan combine rice, butter, garlic, lime peel, chicken broth and water. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook 15-20 minutes, until rice is tender. Remove from heat. In a small bowl combine lime juice, sugar and cilantro. Pour over hot cooked rice.
Serve with Pork Barbacoa

name: Pork Barbacoa Salad Dressing
directions: Mix together in the blender… and that’s it!

name: Baked Meatballs
ingredients: 1 beaten egg (2 T. Dry Egg Powder + 1/4 c. water)
directions: Combine ingredients and form into walnut size balls and bak in jelly roll pan at 425 for about 10-15 minutes or brown in 3 T. Butter on large skillet.

name: Swedish Meatballs
directions: Combine 2/3 cup evaporated milk, onion, crumbs, salt, allspice and pepper. Add meat; mix well, chill. Shape meat mixture into 1-in. balls. In large skillet, brown meatballs in butter. Dissolve bouillon cubes in boiling water; pour over meatballs and bring to boil over medium heat. Cover; simmer for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, blend together cold water and flour. Remove meatballs from skillet, skim fat from pan juices and reserve juices. Stir 1 cup evaporated milk and flour/water mixture into pan juices in skillet; cook, uncovered, over low heat, stirring until sauce thickens. Return meatballs to skillet. Stir in lemon juice. Serve with cooked noodles that have been tossed with poppy seeds and butter.

name: Spaghetti and Meatballs
directions: Cook noodles.  Cook meatballs and sauce.  Serve.

name: Golden Graham S'mores
directions: Heat corn syrup, butter, chocolate chips, and 2 cups marshmallows until melted, then add vanilla.  Pour over the cereal and add in last cup of marshmallows.  Press into a 9x13 pan or lay out on wax paper.

name: Chicken Noodle Soup
directions: In a large stock pot, saute celery and onion in butter or margarine.
Add chicken, carrots, water, bouillon cubes, marjoram, black pepper, bay leaf, and parsley. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Add noodles, and simmer for 10 more minutes.
(I broiled 3 chicken breasts with canadian steak seasoning.  Instead of water and bouillon I used 3 cans chicken broth and 6 cups of water)

name: Tater Tot Casserole
ingredients: 2 lb . bag of frozen tater tots
directions: Brown hamburger; add onions.  Add garlic.  Salt and pepper to taste.  In a bowl, mix cream of mushroom soup and milk with a wire whisk until smooth.  Spray a 9x13 inch pan.  Layer green beans, hamburger mixture and tater tots.  Pour soup mix over all.  Top with grated cheese.  Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
Serve with tossed salad and french bread.

name: Meat Roll
directions: Combine flour, salt and baking powder.  Cut in shortening thoroughly.  Stir in milk.  If too sticky, add a bit of flour.  Roll out 1/4" thick, into a 9x15 rectangle.

Mix all of rest of ingredients.  Spread over the top of the dough.  Roll up like you would if you were making cinnamon rolls.  Cut into 1" slices.   Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.  Make gravy with a can of chicken or mushroom soup and milk.  Or use your favorite gravy recipe.  Pour over rolls.  Great served with mashed potatoes.

name: Bundt Pan Bread
directions: Thaw loaves.  Slice each loaf in 10 slices.  Dip them in butter and arrange them alternating white and wheat pieces in a bundt pan.  Rise for 2-3 hours.  Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes.  Turn out on to a plate.

name: Strawberry Cream Trifle
ingredients: 1 16 oz container frozen sliced strawberries in syrup, thawed
directions: Coarsely chop almonds.  Cut pound cake into 1 inch cubes.  Hull strawberries and cut into quarters.  Combine the fresh and frozen strawberries, mix well.  Juice the lemon for 2 T of juice.  Whisk lemon juice, pudding mix, and yogurt until smooth.  Fold in 1 cup of the whipped topping.

To assemble the trifle: place 1/3 of the cake cubes in the bottom of a clear glass bowl.  Top with 1/3 of the strawberry mixture and then with half the yogurt mixture.  Sprinkle with 1/3 of the almonds.  Repeat layers one more time.  Top with remaining cake cubes and then strawberry mixture.
To garnish, spread remaining whipped topping over the top of the trifle.  Sprinkle with remaining almonds and powdered sugar, if desired.

name: Homemade slurpees
ingredients: 1 6oz can of any kind of frozen juice
directions: Put Kool-aid, sugar and water in blender.  Blend.  Divide liquid in half, leaving half in blender.  Add 2 1/2 c ice and blend.  Pour into glasses.  Do the same with the remaining.  Our favorites are grape juice with grape Kool-aid, fruit punch with tropical Kool-aid, pink lemonade with pink lemonade Kool-aid.

name: Mexican Lasagna
ingredients: 1 cups grated Monterey jack cheese with peppers or cheddar cheese
directions: Brown ground beef; drain.  Add cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, pepper and tomatoes.  Heat through.  Spray a 9x13 pan.  Cover bottom of pan with 1/2 of tortillas.  Pour beef mixture over tortillas; place remainder of tortillas over meat mixture and set aside.  Combine cottage cheese, monterey jack cheese, and egg; pour over tortillas.  Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.  Remove from oven; diagonally across center of casserole, make row first of cheddar cheese, then on either side shredded lettuce, tomatoes, olives and green onions.
Serve with mexican rice, salsa, tortilla chips and corn.

name: Honey Curry Chicken
directions: (I usually do half the sauce and it is plenty for 3-4 chickens)

Melt butter in saucepan or microwave.  Add remaining ingredients except for chicken and stir together, just until warm.  Spray 9x13 pan.  Put in chicken.  Pour sauce over chicken.  Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes to an hour.  Serve over rice.

name: French Toast Stuffed with Blueberries
ingredients: 8 1 inch slices crusty sourdough bread, cubed
directions: Butter a 9 inche square pan.  Place half of the bread cubes in the bottom of the pan.  Scatter cream cheese cubes over the bread and top with blueberries.  Top with remaining bread cubes.  Mix together the eggs, maple syrup and milk.  Pour egg mix over the bread mix, making sure to wet the top layer of bread cubes.  Cover with foil and refrigerate overnight.  Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Bake french toast covered with foil for 30 minutes.  Remove foil and bake for an additional 30 minutes.  Remove from oven and let stand for 15 minutes before serving with blueberry syrup.

Blueberry syrup: In medium saucepan, stir together sugar, cornstarch, and 1 cup water.  Cook over medium heat until thick and clear.  Add 1 cup fresh or frozen blueberries and 2 T butter and simmer until the blueberries pop and the syrup is a thick blue color.  Serve warm over baked French Toast.

name: Italian Vegetable Soup
directions: Brown hamburger in large pot; drain.  Add all the ingredients except the cabbage, green beans and macaroni.  Bring to a boil.  Lower heat; cover and simmer 20 minutes.  Add cabbage, green beans and macaroni; bring to a boil and then lower heat and simmer until vegetables are tender and macaroni is done.  Can add additional water if you desire a thinner soup.  Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese before serving.

name: Parmesan Chicken
directions: Mix yogurt, mayo, lemon juice and 1 T Parmesan cheese, spread over chicken breast (add more cheese, you want a thick layer totally covering the yogurt mixture).  Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

name: Grilled Chicken Caesar Salad
directions: Pour 2 T dressing over chicken in a plastic bag.  Seal bag; turn to coat chicken with dressing.  Refrigerate 30 min to marinate.

Meanwhile, heat grill to medium heat.  Remove chicken from marinade; discard marinade.  Thread chicken onto 4 skewers.  Grill 6 to 8 minutes turning occasionally.  Add bread to grill; cook 1 minute or each side or until toasted on both sides.  Rub toast with garlic; brush with oil.
Arrange toast and lettuce on platter; drizzle with remaining dressing.  Top with chicken skewers and cheese.

name: Microwave Enchiladas
directions: Microwave meat and onions in a 2 qt dish on high 4 to 6 minutes or until meat is done, stirring every 2 min; drain.  Stir in tomato sauce sauce, water and chili powder.  Microwave 5 to 9 minutes or until slightly thickened, stirring every 4 min.  Transfer to bowl.  Place 1 tortilla in same dish; top with layers of one fourth each meat sauce and cheese.  Repeat layers 3 times.  Microwave 2 to 5 minutes or until heated through.  Let stand 5 minutes.  Top with tomatoes and sour cream.

name: Easy Frog Eye Salad
ingredients: 1 1/3 cups (8 oz.) RONZONI ACINE DI PEPE, uncooked
1 can (20 oz.) pineapple chunks in juice, undrained
2 cans (11-oz. each) mandarin orange segments, drained
3 1/2 cups (8 oz.) frozen non-dairy whipped topping
directions: Cook pasta according to package directions; drain. Rinse with cold water to cool quickly; drain well. Meanwhile, drain juice from pineapple chunks, reserving 1/4 cup. In large bowl, add reserved juice, milk, sugar and pudding mix; beat with whisk or electric mixer until well blended, about 1 to 2 minutes. Add pasta to pudding mixture; stir gently. Let stand 10 minutes. Add crushed pineapple and chunks, oranges, 2 cups whipped topping, marshmallows and coconut; mix gently and throughly. Cover; refrigerate until cold. Top with remaining whipped topping; garnish with cherries. 12 servings (about 1 cup each).

name: Kabobs
directions: Marinate chicken or beef.  Skewer everything and then grill.

name: Tin Foil Dinner
directions: Put ingredients in tinfoil and cook in oven until done.

name: Grilled Pork Chop Dinner
directions: Season and grill.
Serve with rice-a-roni

name: Alice Springs Chicken
directions: Use and electric mixer to combine the Dijon mustard, honey, 1 1/2 teaspoons oil, and lemon juice in a small bowl.  Whip the mixture for about 30 seconds.
Pour about 2/3s of the marinade over the chicken breast and marinate them, covered, in the refrigerator for about 2 hours.  Chill the remaining marinade until later.

After the chicken has marinated, preheat the oven to 375 degrees F and heat up an ovenproof frying pan large enough to hold all 4 breasts and 1 TBS of oil over medium heat.  Sear the chicken in the pan for 3 to 4 minutes per side or until golden brown.  Remove the pan from the heat, but keep the chicken in the pan.
As the chicken is cooking, in a small frying pan saute the sliced mushrooms in butter.
Brush each seared chicken breast with a little of the reserved honey mustard marinade, being sure to save a little extra to serve on the side.
Season the chicken with salt, pepper, and a dash of paprika.
Stack two pieces of cooked bacon, crosswise, on each chicken breast.
Spoon the sauteed mushrooms onto the bacon, being sure to coat each breast separately.
Spread 1/4 cup of each cheese onto each chicken breast.
Bake 7 to 10 minutes until cheese is melted.
Sprinkle with parsley before serving.  Serve with extra honey mustard

name: Smokey Mountain Chicken
directions: Preheat the outdoor grill
Oil chicken breasts and sprinkle salt, thyme and savory on each one.
Grill the chicken on hot covered grill for 4 to 5 minutes per side.  After flipping wait a couple minutes then put ham on the grill (don't scorch the ham).
When the chicken is 1 minutes away from done, brush 1 TBS of BBQ sauce over the entire face-up surface.
Stack 2 slices of ham on each breast, then lay a slice of provolone on top.
Grill the chicken until the cheese has melted.
Top with tomatoes and green onions.
Server with rice or french fries.

name: Shepherds Pie
directions: cook ground beef in tomato sauce
build in layers

name: Zucchini Bread
ingredients: 2 cups sugar (1 1/2 when using chocolate chips)
directions: Combine eggs, sugar, oil, zucchini and vanilla.  Sift flour, soda, salt, cinnamon, baking powder together 3 times, then add to zucchini mixture, blending well.  Stir in chopped nuts and chocolate chips.  Grease and flour (or spray with pam) two loaf pans.  Pour batter into pans.  Bake in 350 degree oven for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until toothpick inserted comes out clean.

name: Herb Roasted Pork Loin and Potatoes
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

In a pot with enough water to cover, boil the potatoes for about 10 minutes. Drain, cool, and place in a bowl. Toss with olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon thyme, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, chives, salt, and pepper.
Rub the pork loin roast with 1 teaspoon thyme, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, and onion powder. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Place the roast on a rack in a shallow roasting pan, and cook 50 minutes in the preheated oven. Arrange the potatoes around the roast, and continue cooking 50 minutes, to an internal temperature of 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Remove from heat, cover with foil, and let sit 15 minutes before slicing.
Can use slow cooker on high for 3 hours.  Could also sear the roast.

name: Favorite Dessert
directions: Make graham cracker crust with butter and sugar.  Thaw lemonade and mix with sweetened condensed milk then mix with Cool Whip.  Freeze.

name: Honey Lime Enchiladas
ingredients: 5 tbsp lime juice (1 large or 2 small limes)
1 lb chicken, cooked and shredded (3 small chicken breasts)
directions: Cook chicken in crockpot until able to shred.

Mix the first four ingredients and toss with shredded chicken. Let it marinate for at least 1/2 hour. Pour about 1/2 cup enchilada sauce on the bottom of a 9X13 baking pan. Fill flour tortillas with chicken and shredded cheese, saving about 1 cup of cheese to sprinkle on top of enchiladas. Mix the remaining enchilada sauce with the cream and leftover marinade. Pour sauce on top of the enchiladas and sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes until brown and crispy on top.

name: Country Ribs
directions: Place ribs, bbq sauce, sweet and sour sauce in crockpot and cook all day.  Serve over rice.
Pressure Cooker:

Brown salt, pepper, garlic and paprika seasoned ribs in oil in cooker.  Add 1/2 c cider vinegar and a large pinch of brown sugar.  Cook for 22 minutes on high pressure.  Natural release for 5 minutes then quick release the rest.  Remove pork and strain/reserve juices.  Add pork, bbq sauce (1 cup), sweet and sour (2/3 cup), 1 cup juices.  Cook for 3 minutes and quick release.

name: Dutch Oven Potatoes
directions: Brown bacon and remove.  Use fat to cook onions.  Then slice potatoes and layer with bacon and onions.  Season and top with butter.  Cook until done.

name: Sesame Chicken Kabobs
ingredients: 1 chopped green onion, to taste (I usually use 1-2)
2 large boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1 inch pieces
directions: Mix soy sauce, honey, sesame seeds, green onion and ginger in a ziploc bag. Add chicken. Marinate for 3-6 hours. Soak sticks in water to prevent burning. Place chicken chunks on sticks and place on grill. Cook till chicken is done.
I also like to grill pineapple on separate sticks because it cooks more even and goes well with the chicken.

name: Creamy Cauliflower and Bacon Soup
ingredients: 2 cups half and half cream, divided
directions: Place cauliflower in streamer basket, place in a large sauce pan over 1 in of water. bring to a boil; cover and steam for 8-10 minutes or until tender. cool slightly.
Place cauliflower and 1/2 cup cream in a food processor; cover and process until pureed.  transfer to a large saucepan.
Stir in the cheese, salt, nutmeg, pepper and remaining cream.  Add enough water to reach desired consistency; heat through sprinkle each serving with bacon.

name: Cheese topped lemon chicken breasts
directions: Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper.  In a large skillet, brown chicken in butter on both sides over medium heat.  Stir in lemon juice and soy sauce.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat; cover and cook for 4-5 minutes or until meat juices run clear.
Remove from the heat.  Sprinkle each chicken breast with cheese.  Cover and let stand for 2-3 minutes or until cheese it melted.

name: Cheeseburger cups
directions: In a large skillet, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain.  Stir in the ketchup, brown sugar, mustard and Worcestershire sauce.  Remove form the heat; set aside.
Press each biscuit onto the bottom and up the sides of a greased muffin cup.  Spoon beef mixture into cups; top with cheese cubes.  Bake at 400 degrees for 14-16 minutes or until golden brown.

name: Scalloped Potatoes
